numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy admissions exist in Ivy League schools.
2. A legacy applicant is a person whose family has a history of attending a specific Ivy League school.
3. A legacy applicant has a higher chance of acceptance than a non-legacy applicant.
4. An upper-class person has a higher chance of acceptance to an Ivy League school than a middle-class person.
5. An upper-class person has a higher chance of acceptance to an Ivy League school than a lower-class person.
7. A wealthier person is not necessarily more advanced in education than a less wealthy person.
8. A wealthier person is not necessarily more talented than a less wealthy person.
